about_the_game:
Work your way through delivering food, groceries and more using Delivoo and save enough money to open up your restaurant!

The game idea revolves around simulating the role of a local item delivery person. You have a smartphone with an app installed that notifies you of active orders from all around Peytor Town. While you discover the city and earn money walking / running / driving / cycling / commuting / etc your backpack around, you will face a number of challenges.

Keep An Eye On Temperatures

Depending on the type of items you carry in your backpack, you need to carefully arrange them in such way that frozen pizzas don't melt and nachos cheese sauce doesn't get cold. You can upgrade it to carry more items or even have better temperature insulation.

Make Sure You've Got Change

Some customers will prefer to pay cash, so make sure to manage your wallet contents carefully and don't forget to visit the ATM every now and then. If you don't have exact change, you can either bargain and hope for the best or make the customer wait ... your rating will likely suffer.

Grind Your Way Through Delivoo Partner Program

While short and easy orders are smooth, longer distance ones will pay more. Even better: rush hour and weather conditions also influences your payment.
These perks are only available to Delivoo Partners only, so make sure to keep your rating up and customers happy in order to get bronze, silver, gold or even platinum Partner Level.
PS: There's no rating that many can't magically remove

Find your way through Peytor Town

The city is large - so large, in fact, that it has a shore with a beach, a crowded old town, a busy office area, a picturesque mountain road leading to Holywood grade villas and more. Getting around the city can prove to be complicated, depending on the vehicle you pick:
  • Your own two feet
  • Public transportation (You'll need tickets or subscriptions)
  • Bicycle
  • E-Bike (You'll need to charge it or spend twice the effort to pedal it)
  • Electric scooter
  • Car (Gas, maintenance, taxes, parking passes, all that jazz)
  • Electric Car (Pick a good one)!
You can either rent or buy dozens of vehicles of this type and leave them around town so you can easily switch between them to beat the traffic and deliver that hotdog as it's still steaming hot!
